problem: An international meeting is held between England, Germany, and France.  Three representatives attend from England, four from Germany, and two from France.  How many ways can all nine representatives sit around a circular table, if representatives of the same country sit together?  (Two ways are considered the same if one can be rotated to produce the other.)
model_solution:
1. Treat the representatives of the same country as indistinguishable groups and arrange the groups around the circular table.
2. There are 3! ways to arrange the 3 groups around the circular table, since the groups are indistinguishable.
3. There are 3! ways to arrange the 3 groups internally, since there are 3 groups.
4. For each of the 3! arrangements of the groups, there are 3! ways to arrange the 3 groups internally, and there are 3! ways to arrange the representatives within the German group, and there are 2! ways to arrange the representatives within the French group.
5. There are 3! ways to arrange the representatives within the English group, so the total number of arrangements is 
3!

3! = 3! × (3!)^3 × 2! × 3!

3! = 3! × (3!)^3 × 2! × 6!
7. 3! × (3!)^3 × 2! × 6! = 6 × 6^3 × 2 × 720 = 6 × 216 × 2 × 720 = 1244160
3! × (3!)^3 × 2! × 6! = 6 × 6^3 × 2 × 720 = 6 × 216 × 2 × 720 = 1244160

3! × (3!)^3 × 2! × 6! = 6 × 6^3 × 2 × 720 = 6 × 216 × 2 × 720 = 1244160
